Aegis Harness.description: Item that blocks the damage and effects of the next enemy psychic power.
Aegis Harness.flavor: Imbued with psycho-conductive filaments and hexagrammic wards, Aegis armour represents perhaps the Imperium's most effective defence against psychic attack. Most commonly employed by the Inquisition's Ordo Malleus in their crusade to purge the taint of Chaos from the galaxy.
Aegis Harness.name: Aegis Harness

Adamantium Weave Vest.flavor: When you want to make something invulnerable, you make it from adamantium. Used in the construction of both Terminator Armour or the construction of Titans, this is the strongest material known to man. This vest only has a tiny amount in it, woven in with plasteel and ceramite, but it's enough to make it exceedingly protective.
Adamantium Weave Vest.name: Adamantium Weave Vest

Armaplas Bracers.flavor: Made of the same material as the Imperial Carapace Armour, these matched sets of arm shields mildly increase the wearer's survivability. It's the built-in tactical cogitators, however, that give the wearer a much better hope of living through the next fight.
Armaplas Bracers.name: Armaplas Bracers

Axe of Blind Fury.description: Item that grants a cleave effect to all melee weapons.
Axe of Blind Fury.flavor: Bound within this fabled axe is the essence of a Greater Daemon. It rages against its eternity of servitude, resulting in grievous violence against the enemy and, sometimes, its owner!
Axe of Blind Fury.name: Axe of Blind Fury

Blight Grenade.description: Item that deals damage to the target enemy infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Blight Grenade.flavor: The use of the diseases contained in Blight Grenades was a war crime in ancient history. Modern examples are rare, but the Chaos Marines of Nurgle often create their own, with the shrapnel forcing lethal pathogens into the tiniest cracks in armour.
Blight Grenade.rawXML:
<actions>
		<blightGrenade charges="1" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/PsychicDebuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Blighted"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blightGrenade>
	</actions>
Blight Grenade.name: Blight Grenade

Blind Grenade.description: Item that reduces the accuracy of the target enemy infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Blind Grenade.flavor: Blind grenades are a more complex version of a smoke grenade, releasing a dense dark grey smoke cloud, as well as infrared bafflers, broad spectrum electromagnetic radiation and chaff to disrupt enemy scanners. The broad range of interference makes most forms of direct attack through it impossible for a short time.
Blind Grenade.rawXML:
<actions>
		<blindGrenade charges="1" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/PsychicDebuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Blind"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blindGrenade>
	</actions>
Blind Grenade.name: Blind Grenade

Combat Stimulant.flavor: Combat Stimulants like Frenzon or Onslaught are regarded with distaste by most species, given that their manufacture and testing sometimes require the liquidation of innocent victims (especially if Slaaneshi cults are involved). Despite this, the Imperial forces dispense these regularly to both Penal Legions and the much-feared Eversor Assassins.
Combat Stimulant.rawXML:
<actions>
		<combatStimulant charges="1" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/PsychicBuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Items/CombatStimulant"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</combatStimulant>
	</actions>
Combat Stimulant.name: Combat Stimulant

Concealed Weapon System.flavor: Hiding a weapon isn't a new idea, but a true Concealed Weapon System secretes the killing tool in such a way that it's undetectable until use—as clothing, jewellery or even as biological elements. The element of surprise heavily increases its efficacy.
Concealed Weapon System.name: Concealed Weapon System

Dimensional Key.description: Item that allows the hero to teleport to an explored tile.
Dimensional Key.flavor: This ancient key is carved from the thighbone of a Daemon Prince. When thrust into the heart of a dying warrior, it unlocks the barriers between worlds: a howling gale of Chaos blows, disorienting any nearby mortals not pledged to the Dark Gods. Worse still, the key guides those nearing the battlefield through the Warp.
Dimensional Key.name: Dimensional Key

Dusk Blade.description: Item that grants life steal to all melee weapons.
Dusk Blade.flavor: The Dawn Blade that the traitor Commander Farsight discovered was unique—but to erase his memory Earth Caste artisans and Water Caste diplomats created this weapon for Coldflame. It may look the same as the iconic Dawn Blade, but it possesses none of its unearthly power—instead, the advanced medical technology embedded in it can draw on the battlesuit’s power to heal the wielder.
Dusk Blade.name: Dusk Blade

Endurance Implant.flavor: An atypical Jokaero device, this implant weaves its way into the host organism, to optimise its biological systems. Its user will find itself tireless, able to run faster, fight for longer, and generally keep going—until its overwrought body gives way, that is.
Endurance Implant.name: Endurance Implant

Entropic Locum.description: Item that increases the armour penetration.
Entropic Locum.flavor: Apparently using similar design principles to a Graviton Gun, this Jokaero device can be used alongside a gunsight or parallel to a weapon’s blade. When activated, it causes the molecules in a very small volume of the target to become disordered and collapse inwards, leading to a single weak spot on the target that your weapon just happens to already be pointing at.
Entropic Locum.name: Entropic Locum

Faolch\u00fa's Wing.description: Item that consumes action to increase movement.
Faolch\u00fa's Wing.flavor: When Eldanesh fell battling Khaine, the great falcon Faolchú was disconsolate. Faolchú gifted a single golden pinfeather to Eldanesh’s heirs, that perhaps its swiftness might aid them where her own had failed. Legend tells that this artefact is that selfsame token of grief, handed down through generations of Aeldari, and surviving even the tumult of the Fall.
Faolch\u00fa's Wing.rawXML:
<actions>
		<faolchusWing cooldown="1" consumedMovement="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/MysticBuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Items/FaolchusWing" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</faolchusWing>
	</actions>
Faolch\u00fa's Wing.name: Faolchú's Wing

Forbidden Knowledge.flavor: This box of black stone is heavily inscribed in ancient runes, possibly Exodite, possibly Old One. Who knows what it holds? Whispered secrets an aeon-old? Deadly traps? Miracles of knowledge long thought lost? Unholy power from unholy gods? Only a soul brave enough to open it and discover for themselves will ever know…
Forbidden Knowledge.rawXML:
<actions>
		<forbiddenKnowledge charges="1" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/MysticBuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<level add="1"/>
										<influencePerExperience max="0"/>
										<researchPerExperience max="0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</forbiddenKnowledge>
	</actions>
Forbidden Knowledge.name: Forbidden Knowledge

Jokaero Digital Weapon.description: Item that deals damage to the target enemy unit.
Jokaero Digital Weapon.flavor: Miniaturized killing tools of remarkable power, commonly concealed within jewellery, and created by a race of primate-like xenos with an apparently instinctive understanding of technology. The Imperium has, as yet, been unable to replicate the construction of these digi-weapons.
Jokaero Digital Weapon.rawXML:
<actions>
		<jokaeroDigitalWeapon consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" icon="Items/JokaeroDigitalWeapon" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Weapons/StaffOfLight" soundCount="3"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1" lineOfSight="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="JokaeroDigitalWeapon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</jokaeroDigitalWeapon>
	</actions>
Jokaero Digital Weapon.name: Jokaero Digital Weapon

Laurels of Command.description: Item that restores the morale of this unit and nearby allied units in range.
Laurels of Command.flavor: The Laurels of Command are a callous and controversial means to ensure obedience. Concealed within their peerless artistry is a band of empathic-impulsion circuitry which allows the wearer limited control over the minds of indoctrinated individuals via subliminal suggestion. Under their effects even cowards fight to the last, while orders are executed in perfect synchronisation.
Laurels of Command.rawXML:
<actions>
		<laurelsOfCommand cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" icon="Items/LaurelsOfCommand" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/MysticBuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale add="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</laurelsOfCommand>
	</actions>
Laurels of Command.name: Laurels of Command

Lightning Gauntlet.description: Item that increases the damage of the next melee attack.
Lightning Gauntlet.flavor: With talons created from adamantium and the telltale blue glow of a power weapon, Lightning Claws are normally only mounted on Terminator armour. However rare single gauntlets can be found small enough to be carried by a normal warrior.
Lightning Gauntlet.name: Lightning Gauntlet

Man-Catcher.description: Item that reduces the movement of the target enemy unit.
Man-Catcher.flavor: An ancient capture device whose spiked collar violently dissuades its prisoner from attempting escape, and may loosen their tongue to boot. Though most consider it too primitive a weapon, a handful of Inquisitors are resolute that its simple barbarism achieves results that more contemporary methods simply cannot.
Man-Catcher.rawXML:
<actions>
		<poweredBolas cooldown="2" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<model>
				<action sound="Actions/PsychicDebuff"/>
			</model>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
			\
